subject: Nutrition
title: Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport
description: One-minute skill: Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport.

hook.text: When athletes undereat, their bodies shut down systems deemed non-essential. The damage is invisible.

buildup.text: RED-S affects hormones, bones, immunity, and mental health. It's far more common than coaches realize.

discovery.text: Once called the Female Athlete Triad, research confirms it affects male athletes equally.

twist.text: Many athletes with RED-S don't look underweight. The calorie deficit is internal and invisible.

climax.text: Recovery requires eating more, not exercising less. Restoring energy balance reverses most symptoms.

punchline.text: Sport's biggest risk isn't overtraining but underfueling.

quiz.question: Does RED-S only affect female athletes?
